TextBody:
Hello Philip,

Thank you for reaching out to Netwrix support regarding your issue. I would be happy to assist you. I have provided documentation that details all locations the service account credentials need to be updated below:
 

	Updating Passwords

In this case the AIC credentials can be updated in the windows services console for the AIC service.

Thank you,


Scottie Taylor
Technical Support Engineer

Subject: Unable to contact ActiveDirectory / An unknown error has occurred while logging in    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0OQDVI:ref ]

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000OQDVI:ref

I figured it out.  I followed that documentation.  The problem is that it does not at all mention that if, in Access Information Center, if you set the Configuration credentials under Active Directory, they must be changed prior to changing the service account password or while still logged in.  I deleted this setting from the AccessInformationCenter.Service.exe.Config and was then able to login and reset it to the new password.

[cid:image003.png@01DBB52D.6DDE69D0]




Best Regards,
Philip Richards, CISSP
Cybersecurity Product Manager | Cybersecurity

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #443134 - ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000OQDVI:ref - Unable to contact ActiveDirectory / An unknown error has occurred while logging in    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0OQDVI:ref ]

TextBody:
Hello Philip,

I am glad that we were able to get your issue resolved. The following is a summary of the ticket for your records.

Symptom

The Service account password was updated and now Access Information Center will not allow authentication of users. Enterprise Auditor has no issues.

Cause

Service account credentials updated.

Resolution

Provided the document below detailing all locations that the service account credentials need to be updated. Also updated account information within the configuration settings for the AIC.

Following this email, you will receive an automated confirmation that the case is closed, along with the ability to re-open the case if any related errors return. In addition, you will also receive a separate email with a survey where you can let us know how we did. Feel free to leave any feedback via the survey link!

Thank you,

Scottie Taylor
Technical Support Engineer
____________________________
Cybersecurity That Works For You

6160 Warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034
www.netwrix.com
